CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A14, reads: "Mrs. Raymond B. Mahoney... in stunning ceremony. - Harris Photo." Accompanying article reads: "Hurst - Mahoney Rites in Pittsburgh. A wedding of much charm and beauty was held at St. James AME Church recently, when the Rev. Augustus Sumpter united in marriage, Miss Ethel Hurst, daughter of Mrs. Inez E. Hurst, of Pittsburgh, and Thomas J. Hurst St., of Fort Wayne, Ind., and Raymond B. Mahoney, son of Mrs. Robert Mahoney.  The bride, given in marriage by her father, wore an exquisite ballerina-length gown of eggshell silk taffeta, embellished with appliqued lace medallions and pallettes.  A shoulder-length veil and matching mitts completed her elegant outfit. She carried yellow roses.  Mrs. Christine Seals of Fort Wayne, Ind. sister of the bride, was matron of honor.  Bridesmaid were Mrs. Julia Gaines of Pittsburgh, and Mrs. Fannie Wagstaff of Fort Wayne, other sisters of the bride, and Mrs. Kathleen Hurst and Mrs. Euzee Mahoney.  Mrs. Seals wore apple green and the maids wore apricot chiffon and satin created on simple, yet stunning lines.  Miss Jacqueline Seals was junior bridesmaid.  Little Karen Hurst was a delightful flower girl, and Eric (Rickey) Poole was ring bearer, carrying the real wedding bands on a satin pillow.  Robert Mahoney served his brother as best man, while ushers included: Robert Lavelle, Harry Moore, Charles Palmer, and Theodore Steward.  Mrs. Elizabeth Youngue was the soloist.  Mrs. Mary McEinheimer directed the wedding.  Aides included: Mmes. Ethel Moore, Lucille Cuthbert, Hallie Turner, Marie Simmons, "Kitten" Irvis, Eloise Page, Wilnette Young, Margaret Jane Smith, Gladys Stanton, Jeanne Poole, Adah Lavelle, Margaret Terry, Jeannette Davis, Jean Bolden Parish, Alice Woodruff and Miss Alma Thompson....The newlyweds moved into their new home on Dreary [Deary] St., Pittsburgh, following a brief honeymoon in Cleveland."
TitMainTitle: Bride Ethel Hurst Mahoney wearing short sleeved silk taffeta gown and holding bouquet of roses, walking up aisle with man, possibly her father Thomas J. Hurst, in St. James AME Church
